title: Defining Clear Roles
content: Role clarity prevents gaps and overlaps. Every team member should know: what they're responsible for, what authority they have, who they coordinate with, and what others expect from them. Ambiguous roles create confusion, conflict, and dropped tasks.

mcq.question: Two team members both assume the other is monitoring a critical parameter. Neither monitors it. What failed?

options.B: Role definition failedâ€”responsibility wasn't clearly assigned

mcq.explanation: When everyone assumes someone else has a responsibility, no one does. Clear role definition includes explicit assignment: 'You are responsible for monitoring X.' Assumption is the enemy of accountability.
